Articles.Content:
So the parts from the tech tree got messed up and if I lack the patience to organise everything back in place I might turn to a custom one.

 

What I'm looking for is a tech tree that is somehow based on human history of jet/rocket  propulsion research. A post WW2 thing. You start with Juno engine and tiny size rockets. Build your first Me 262, break some records. Then you get the Wheesley and find out it's not that good for your Stiletto, and so on and so forth. Is there anything like that with stock parts? And I don't want RSS. I'm a casual, you know.

On 12/16/2015, 1:32:21, Veeltch said:

So the parts from the tech tree got messed up and if I lack the patience to organise everything back in place I might turn to a custom one.

 

What I'm looking for is a tech tree that is somehow based on human history of jet/rocket  propulsion research. A post WW2 thing. You start with Juno engine and tiny size rockets. Build your first Me 262, break some records. Then you get the Wheesley and find out it's not that good for your Stiletto, and so on and so forth. Is there anything like that with stock parts? And I don't want RSS. I'm a casual, you know.

There is this Engineering Tech Tree. Look it up. I installed it a few days ago, and it's great. Much more convenient and sensible than default tech tree, and at the same time is still balanced and challenging.

I'll bump this because EET doesn't seem to fit my needs (took me a while, I know). It has a lot of not used nodes when played with stock parts. Any other tech trees I don't know about that work with stock, KIS/KAS and USI-LS?

EDIT: Found this one: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/110365-104-opentree-a-rebalanced-tech-tree-w-more-choice-clearer-development-mod-support-v23/

Edited January 23, 2016 by Veeltch
